intro: Philippimalva, commonly known as the Malva of the Philippines, is a flowering plant native to the archipelago of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Philippimalva is not only ornamental but also holds cultural significance in some local communities.
